content: **attention the last part of seeking balance will be released on sunday 6th of august ** **16-4-2023 attention in part 1 the total of r12 in the yan part must be 88 sts instead of 80 sts this error occured in all translations ** the cal is divided into 17 parts they will be released weekly the pattern will be available in 13 languages afrikaans danish dutch english uk terms english us terms finnish french german hebrew indonesian italian spanish urdu it is a challenging pattern with lots of special figures and stitches and quite a lot of different techniques applied from irish crochet to overlay mosaic to interlocking there are even a few plain rounds included it requires concentration and accurate reading of the descriptions however the descriptions are very detailed with lots of pictures so that an advanced beginner will be able to crochet it and an advanced crocheter won t get bored wonderful tania leis makes a video for every part as support there will also be videos available for left-handed people with fingering yarn and hook size 3mm my square blanket became 125 x 125 cm some of our haaksteek team testers are making seeking balance with thicker yarn and a bigger size hook and their blanket will end up being much much bigger as soon as they have finished their blankets i will tell you the size of their seeking balance my haaksteek team and i have worked on this blanket for many many months i would be nothing without the help of my wonderful haaksteek sisters who worked so hard and put their time energy yarn money and love into this project to make it to its best for all of you the difficult times in my life when i was struggling to not break down were the inspiration for this blanket crocheting using a simple hook in combination with the feeling of soft colorful yarn between my fingers creating something beautiful is so soothing i was able to weave in my difficult memories and yet feel comforted by what was arising from my hands i hope you ll feel as much happiness by weaving in your own sad memories and turning them into peaceful memorials by making your own seeking balance **video s by tania leis** https //www youtube com/playlist list=plm5af3ipuqumjdygkyxd7o0h-ih8mzyv3 my dear crochet friend angelstarknit again offered to host this new cal here on ravelry in her wonderful group https //www ravelry
